intro: Leysera ciliata, commonly known as the silky leaf vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves with fine, ciliate margins. Its flowers are typically small, yellowish-green, and clustered in axillary inflorescences. Leysera ciliata is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and forest understories.
